description: Uncertain, probably risen out of a British dialect (OED finds candidate words in Herefordshire, Gloucestershire, southern Cheshire, and Sheffield). "The formation seems to be onomatop≈ìic, expressive of the notion of throwing down roughly and untidily" [OED].

verbs.description: flummox (third-person singular simple present flummoxes, present participle flummoxing, simple past and past participle flummoxed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To confuse; to fluster; to flabbergast.
(intransitive, uncommon) To give in, to give up, to collapse.
